panels.description: Status returned from the `/readyz` health status endpoint. Unhealthy reasons include beacon node problems, charon p2p problems, or validator client problems.
panels.title: Health Status

panels.description:
- **Uptime**: Total time since cluster start time
- **Slot**: Current slot
- **Epoch**: Current Epoch
- **Validators Active**: Number of active validators in the cluster
- **Charon Peers Connected**: Number of Peers in the cluster
- **Relays Connected**: Number of Relays connected to the cluster
- **Beacon Node Peers**: Beacon Node Peers connected, based on app_beacon_node_peers
- **P2P Reachability**" Latest P2P reachability status, based on p2p_reachability_status
panels.title: Current Status

panels.description: Successful cluster duty percentage by type over the whole time range
panels.title: Cluster Duty Success(%)

panels.description:
Information about the charon cluster.

- **Network**: The blockchain network 
- **Operators/Nodes**: The number of operators or nodes or peers in the charon DV cluster.
- **Threshold**: The minimum number of participating nodes (also quorum).
- **Validators**: The number of validators added to the cluster, each validator is staking 32 ETH.

targets.expr:
( 1 * app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", cluster_network="mainnet"} )
or 
( 2 * app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", cluster_network="goerli"} )
or
( 3 * app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", cluster_network="sepolia"} )
or
( 4 * app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", cluster_network="gnosis"} )

panels.title: Cluster Info

panels.description:
This panels shows any health checks that are failing. See <add link> for help troubleshooting.  

Note the different severities:
- **info**: Only informational, might not be an actual problem.
- **warning**: Performance is degraded, operator intervention only required if this persists for a long time.
- **critical**: Significant problem, validators probably not operation at all. Immediate operator intervention required.
panels.title: Failing Health Checks

panels.description: Number of failed duties by reason per time window. Note this is only available from v0.16.
panels.title: ðŸš¨ Duty failure reason: $duty (per $interval)

panels.description:
Requires `--feature-set-enabled=attestation_inclusion` for this panel to be populated. Comes with a non-negligible impact on Beacon Node load so use with caution. 

Tracks duties that was successfully broadcast to the Beacon Node, but that were never included on-chain. This could be due to broadcasting too late (too slow), not enough peers, or other network troubles.
panels.title: ðŸ’¥ Broadcasted duties never included on-chain (per $interval)

panels.description: Number of consensus timeouts per time window.
panels.title: ðŸš¨ Consensus Timeouts (per $interval)

panels.description:
The delay since the expected duty submission time.
For duties broadcasted to the beacon node (i.e.: proposer), successful beacon node response is taken as completion time.
For duties not broadcasted to the beacon node (i.e.: randao), completed consensus is taken as completion time.
panels.title: Submission delay: $duty

panels.description: The leader of final consensus round represented as its cluster peer index. This is the node who proposed the value the cluster came to consensus on to sign.
panels.title: Node that chose the attester data

panels.description: The leader of final consensus round represented as its cluster peer index. This is the node who proposed the value the cluster came to consensus on to sign.
panels.title: Node that chose the proposal data

panels.description: Successful duty participation per peer (filtered by selected duty) over time.
panels.title: âœ… Successful Peer Participation: Duty=$duty

panels.description: Missed duty participation per duty (filtered by peer) over time.
panels.title: ðŸš§ Missed Peer Participation: Peer=$peer

panels.description: Missed duty participation per peer (filtered by selected duty) over time.
panels.title: ðŸš§ Missed Peer Participation: Duty=$duty

panels.description:
Warning (w) and error (e) logs grouped by topic. 

Occasional warns and errors are normal, but a significant increase indicate problems that require operators to investigate by looking at the actual logs entries.
panels.title: Error(e) logs (per $interval)

panels.description:
Warning (w) and error (e) logs grouped by topic. 

Occasional warns and errors are normal, but a significant increase indicate problems that require operators to investigate by looking at the actual logs entries.
panels.title: Warning(w) logs (per $interval)

panels.description: How much ram is the charon client using
panels.title: Charon Memory Usage

panels.description: How much of a CPU is charon using
panels.title: Charon CPU Usage

panels.description: Total time spent on garbage collection per interval
panels.title: Garbage Collection Duration (per $interval)

panels.description: A 2D view of whether the connection between peers is direct or relay and quic or tcp

targets.expr:
# Create a base vector with all possible (cluster_peer, peer) combinations
(
  # Get all unique peer combinations from any connection type
  (max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 0) +
  
  # Add QUIC direct connections (1000 points)
  (max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="direct", protocol="quic"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 1000 or 
   max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 0) +
  
  # Add TCP direct connections (100 points)  
  (max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="direct", protocol="tcp"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 100 or
   max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="direct"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 100 or  # Fallback for old clusters
   max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 0) +
  
  # Add QUIC relay connections (10 points)
  (max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="relay", protocol="quic"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 10 or 
   max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 0) +
  
  # Add TCP relay connections (1 point)
  (max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="relay", protocol="tcp"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 1 or
   max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash", type="relay"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 1 or  # Fallback for old clusters  
   max(p2p_relay_connection_types{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash"}) by (cluster_peer,peer) * 0)
)

panels.title: Relay Connection Types - direct or relay and quic or tcp
